Class UIUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.svvrl.goal.gui.UIUtil

  • public class UIUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides several utilities methods.

    Ming-Hsien Tsai

      • promptSelection

        public static Tab promptSelection(java.awt.Component parent,
                                  java.lang.String title,
                                  java.lang.String desc,
                                  FilterRule<Editable> rule)
                           throws NoAcceptableObjectException
        Displays a dialog for selecting an object from objects that satisfy a specified filter rule. Note that the object in the active tab will be excluded.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent component of the dialog
        title - the title of the dialog
        desc - a description shown in the dialog
        rule - a filter rule specifying what objects can be selected
        Returns:
        the tab containing the selected object, or null if the selection is canceled
        Throws:
        NoAcceptableObjectException - if there is no acceptable object for the selection

      • promptSelection

        public static Tab[] promptSelection(java.awt.Component parent,
                                    java.lang.String title,
                                    java.lang.String desc,
                                    java.lang.String[] names,
                                    FilterRule<Editable>[] rules)
                             throws NoAcceptableObjectException
        Displays a dialog for selecting objects that satisfy specified filter rules.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent component of the dialog
        title - the title of the dialog
        desc - a description shown in the dialog
        names - a name for a selection
        rules - a filter rule specifying what objects can be selected in a selection
        Returns:
        the tab containing the selected object, or null if the selection is canceled
        Throws:
        NoAcceptableObjectException - if there is no acceptable object for the selection

      • promptSelection

        public static <T extends Properties> Pair<Tab,T> promptSelection(Window window,
                                                                 java.lang.String title,
                                                                 java.lang.String desc,
                                                                 FilterRule<Editable> rule,
                                                                 OptionsPanel<T> panel)
                                                          throws NoAcceptableObjectException
        Displays a dialog for (1) selecting an object from objects that satisfy a specified filter rule and (2) adjusting options. Note that the object in the active tab will be excluded.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of options
        Parameters:
        window - the parent window of the dialog
        title - the title of the dialog
        desc - a description shown in the dialog
        rule - a filter rule specifying what objects can be selected
        panel - an options panel
        Returns:
        a pair of the tab containing the selected object and the options, or null if the selection is canceled
        Throws:
        NoAcceptableObjectException - if there is no acceptable object for the selection

      • wrapInHTML

        public static java.lang.String wrapInHTML(java.lang.String str,
                                          int width)
        Wraps text into lines between <html> and </html>. The HTML tag <br/> is used as the line break.
        Parameters:
        str - a string to be wrapped
        width - the maximum width of each line
        Returns:
        the wrapped text

      • wrapTooltip

        public static java.lang.String wrapTooltip(java.lang.String str)
        Wraps tooltip text in HTML for Windows platforms. This method does nothing for Macs.
        Parameters:
        str - a string to be wrapped
        Returns:
        the wrapped string if the platform is Microsoft Windows, or the original input string if the platform is Mac

      • wrapLabel

        public static javax.swing.JLabel wrapLabel(java.lang.String str,
                                           int width)
        Wraps the text in a label with a preferred width on the screen. The height will be computed automatically. This method does not break the text into lines but just sets an appropriate height for the returned label.
        Parameters:
        str - the text to be wrapped
        width - the preferred width of the label on the screen
        Returns:
        a label with the text

      • setColor

        public static javax.swing.undo.UndoableEdit setColor(GraphicComponent[] comps,
                                                     java.awt.Color color,
                                                     boolean extend)
        Sets the color of an array of graphic components. If the argument extend is true and the component is a transition, then all transitions with the same source state and destination state will also be changed. If a component already has the color, it will not be changed.
        Parameters:
        comps - graphic components
        color - the new color, which must be non-null
        extend - indicating if transitions should be extended
        Returns:
        an undoable edit of this color changing, null if no component is changed

      • setTextColor

        public static javax.swing.undo.UndoableEdit setTextColor(GraphicComponent[] comps,
                                                         java.awt.Color color,
                                                         boolean extend)
        Sets the text color of an array of graphic components. If the argument extend is true and the component is a transition, then all transitions with the same source state and destination state will also be changed. If a component already has the color, it will not be changed.
        Parameters:
        comps - graphic components
        color - the new text color, which must be non-null
        extend - indicating if transitions should be extended
        Returns:
        an undoable edit of this color changing, null if no component is changed

      • setOpacity

        public static javax.swing.undo.UndoableEdit setOpacity(GraphicComponent[] comps,
                                                       int opacity)
        Sets the opacity of an array of graphic components. If the component is a transition, then all transitions with the same source state and destination state will also be changed. If a component already has the opacity, it will not be changed.
        Parameters:
        comps - graphic components
        opacity - the new opacity
        Returns:
        an undoable edit of this opacity changing, null if no component is changed

      • resetOpacity

        Resets the opacity of all states and transitions of an automaton.
        Parameters:
        aut - an automaton
        Returns:
        an undoable edit for this opacity reset

        Resets the color of some states and transitions of an automaton.
        Parameters:
        comps - states and transitions with colors to be reset
        Returns:
        an undoable edit for this color reset

      • animatedMove

        public static void animatedMove(State[] states,
                                java.awt.geom.Point2D[] destinations,
                                AutomatonCanvas<?> canvas,
                                int frames,
                                int interval)
        Moves states to their new destinations slowly.
        Parameters:
        states - an array of states
        destinations - destinations of the states
        canvas - the canvas displaying these states
        frames - total number of frames to be played
        interval - time interval between two frames

      • getSelectedAsAutomaton

        public static Automaton getSelectedAsAutomaton(AutomatonEditor<?> editor)
        Returns a new automaton that contains only the selected states in an automaton editor. Transitions between the selected states will also be included in the returned automaton.
        Parameters:
        editor - an automaton editor
        Returns:
        a new automaton that contains only the selected states
